item.title: Report X-2024070064
item.description:
Report X-2024070064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28th during the PM sort a package contained 2 glass bottles of UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL, 3, III was found with signs of leakage. One of the glass bottles inside was found broken and the entire contents leaked out. The bottles were in a plastic bag filled with vermiculite, however the bag was unable to contain all of the spill. The package as placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER DISCOVERED DAMAGED AND LEAKING CARTON ON PALLET OUTSIDE DMP AREA, INSIDE TOTE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS CLEARLY VISIBLE, SO SHE DONNED PPE, INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, AND PROCEEDED TO NEUTRALIZE THE LEAKING ACID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER VERIFIED THAT THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRALIZED USING PH TAPE. THE CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD, CLAY ABSORBANT, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THE ENTIRE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS PLACED INSIDE A GREEN BAG. MORE SODIUM BICARBONATE AND CLAY ABSORBANT WERE ADDED TO THE BAG IN ORDER TO CATCH ANY MORE ACID THAT MAY LEAK FROM THE BATTERY.

  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 95-gallon overpack of sodium hypochlorite fell off of a skid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews re-secured the fallen tote. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070000
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured by fallen freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, neutralizers, granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the UN3265-impacted trailer floor, wooden slab, tote exterior and swept them up. AS deconstructed the wooden slab and conducted a gravity tote transfer into a new 330-gallon poly tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The original tote was deconstructed with and collected into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of organic peroxide was punctured by a nail and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the organic peroxide-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE used hand tools to collect all spilled product and remediated the impacted dock floor with cleaners and absorbents. All spent absorbents and impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, 6/04/2024, at 1121 hours, an FRA Hazmat Inspector in the CSXT Queens Gate Yard discovered UTLX676824, a loaded tank car of Ammonium Nitrate, liquid, had leaked from the Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV). The car was isolated and the shipper, CF Industries Sales LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report#2024-0604-00147). CSXT Hazmat personnel responded to the yard and observed dried product within the service equipment housing that had leaked from the VRV. The valve was not actively leaking at the time of response. The issue was identified as a defective Vacuum Relief Valve and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative, Roy Mathew, 224-804-7190, rmathew@cfindustries.com. The car was held out of transportation pending repair or replacement of the defective valve by a certified mobile repair unit.

item.title: Report E-2024060053
item.description:
Report E-2024060053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: BOYKINS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/3/24, at 1232 hours, personnel in the NCVA Railroad Boykins, VA Yard discovered GBRX709256, a loaded tank car of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, had leaked from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Chemserve Terminals, was notified via CHEMTREC 2024060300092. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene as well as a representative from Chemserve Terminals and found the air line valve open and secondary closure plug not installed. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Matt Law 757-544-0784. Contractor personnel closed the valve and reinstalled the plug and decontaminated the car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport.

item.description:
Report X-2024061572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found by the FRA Hazmat with a leaking secondary closure plug. Upon inspection, the bottom outlet valve was found to be in the fully open position, even though the valve handle was closed and sealed. The valve operating stem had a sheared pin which did not close the valve. A pin was installed, the valve closed, and the plug properly secured. Eight of eight manway swing bolts were also less than tool tight and properly secured.

  • City: ROSWELL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. NOTIFIED RMP OF POTENTIAL LEAKING HAZMAT ON DRIVERS CAR. RMP GATHERED PPE AND OTHER RESPONSE SUPPLIES AND TRAVELLED TO PACKAGE LOCATION. UPON ARRIVAL FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND DONNED PPE, RESPONDED USING THE CORROSIVE SHEET, RMP INSPECTED PACKAGE, SECURED AND CLEANED UP ACCORDING TO RESPONSE SHEET AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE BACK TO SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. PACKAGE WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE AND NO EVIDENCE OF ANY OTHER LEAKAGE BESIDES WET CARDBOARD ON THE BOX. CAP OF INSIDE CONTAINER WAS TIGHT, NO SEAL UNDER CAP.

  • City: PORTLAND

  • Description: A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TOOK THE CALL. THEY DONNED THEIR P.P.E. UPON VISUAL INSPECTIONS/ DISCOVERED THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS A DECLARED CORROSIVE 8 HAZMAT IN A 5-GALLON BUCKET WITH NO ADDITIONAL PACKAGING. RESPONDER USE THE DECISION-TREE AND BASED ON THE LABEL USED THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONSDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. DONNED PPE AND MOVED THE LEAKER TO WORKAREA. REVIEWED PRODUCT AND SDS WITH RMP.

  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by dunnage. The material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents and citric acid were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 4th 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: EDWARDSVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-6ft area of the concrete/asphalt lot and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to a fall during offloading that damaged seven (7) 5-gallon metal pails. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest Dayton Freight terminal for terminal personnel to coordinate disposal. The seven (7) damaged pails were containerized into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and placed into the Dayton Freight trailer for transport to the nearest terminal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A leaking container of hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid was discovered at the Menomonee Falls 10-Day Dock while unloading a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI. The cardboard container was saturated with the liquid, and needed to be repackaged, as well as handled appropriately by a reactives trained Menomonee Falls Field Service employee. An investigation revealed the source of the spill was due to the closure not being secured on the inner package allowing for material to leak out of the top.

item.title: Report E-2024060665
item.description:
Report E-2024060665

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint were dropped during loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted site. Before EW personnel arrived, personnel from the customer location attempted to clean the paint with a power washer, spreading the paint out through the parking lot. Crews deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface area and added the rinsate to the existing drums of waste. All paint-impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail of UN1210 was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060669
item.description:
Report E-2024060669

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: CLIFTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-3ft area of the trailer wall and estimated that forty (40) cardboard packages containing 1-gallon each was damaged from a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of material. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a cleaner to the impacted area and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. The impacted rags were containerized along with impacted cardboard into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the consignee’s location. A second response the next day at the terminal resulted in one (1) ounce of material leaking from the repalletized packages. The contractor deployed a cleaner again to the impacted area of the trailer floor and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. Clean Harbors generated two (2) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) drums of waste were staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060468
item.description:
Report E-2024060468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a puncture to one (1) poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival ESTES terminal personnel had cleaned the impacted area. The area was tested and confirmed as neutralized. The spent material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote. The empty tote was cut up and placed into two (2) cubic yard boxes. All the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • City: DRAPER

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/7/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 619462 at the station location in Draper, reporting an undeclared paint spill. The shipment consisted of 3 plastic buckets packaged inside of a fiberboard box. One of the buckets spilled due to a failed closure. Further inspection of the shipment revealed that the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment did not have the required markings. labeling, packaging or paperwork for air transport. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.

The box was put into a red hazmat bin. when I came in to work to look at the hazmat, I saw the box was dry, but inside the cap to one of the glass 4-liter containers was loose and 2 liters of the liquid was out of the glass liter container. I tightened the lid and checked all the other lids to make sure they were all tight.

The box also appears to have been crushed towards the bottom or dropped from a considerable height. Improper handling of package.

item.description:
Report E-2024060608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1263 RDL39LVOC1 BF USA release from a 44.40-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 30’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by the trailer wall. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF DEGREASER H.D. HEAVY DUTY CONCENTRATE ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE PACKAGE DID HAVE SLOTTED PARTITIONS BUT NO BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION. PACKAGE HANDLER #2972155 DILLON FISHER WAS INJURYED BY PACKAGE DILLION PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AS IT CAME DOWN THE IC BELT NOT KNOWING THAT IT WAS A WET LEAKING HAZMAT GETTING THE LIQUID ON HIS HANDS.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS

  • Description: PACKAGE MARKED PROPERLY, DIAMOND LABEL CORROSIVE 8- UN3264 CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S. (SULFAMIC ACID). CONTENTS WAS 4-1 GALLONS OF ZEP(CALCIUM LIME RUST STAIN REMOVER). THE BOTTLES CAPS WERE LOOSE CAUSING LEAKAGE. THE CAPS WERE TIGHTENED ON ALL 4 BOTTLES. THEN WERE PLACED IN GREEN DMP BAG WITH WET CARDBOARD NAPKINS 5 INCHES OF ZEP ZORBENT AND SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NEUTRALIZE SPILL TO PH RANGE 6-9. AWAITING FURTHER INSTRUCTION FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024061094
item.description:
Report X-2024061094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was discovered wet upon opening the trailer at the beginning of the pre-load sort at around 2:30am according to the OPS Supervisors on duty. Package was then placed into red line hazmat bin & brought to QA for inspection. When the package was discovered by QA, the box was soaked/stained on one side & ripped open. The fiberboard box also had several class 8 corrosive markings, UN/USA markings, & hazmat shipping paperwork attached to it. 4 bottles of Nu-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner were found inside the box w/ 2 each separated by a fiberboard liner. 2 of the bottle's caps had been crushed/bent downward into the body & the 3rd was crushed/bent/squeezed on its body in the middle on each side, causing the contents to leak through the caps. 3 of the bottles were dented on several areas as well. During the inspection process an additional red line hazmat bin was used to inspect the box & contents. A long green rubber glove & several biodegradable single use nitrile gloves were used to handle the corrosive substance. The Improper Shipping Form & Damaged Package Report were filled out & all of the Contents, fiberboard box, & PPE were placed into a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024061059
item.description:
Report X-2024061059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat UN1139 was unloaded in the small unload and van scanned to WA 271 at 6:21AM. The package wasn't noticed to be wet or leaking until the driver inspected the package on his vehicle. Upon the driver's coding, Quality Assurance was immediately notified of the wet package placed in plastic bags to contain the spill. Upon external inspection, The package was wet, had a strong odor, and labels were faded from the liquid. After the tracking number was identified, the internal inspection began. 1 gallon of coval ultimate top coat gloss was leaking due from pressure on the cap and 1 quart of the flammable liquid coating solution leaked out. 3 quarts still remain intact in the 1 gallon plastic bottle. The fiberboard box, plastic bottle containing the coating solution, and the plastic bags were placed securely in a hazardous materials bag and then inside a salvage drum. There was no inner packing materials to lessen the pressure on the cap of the coating solution to prevent the lid from loosening.

item.title: Report E-2024060611
item.description:
Report E-2024060611

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 35-gallon pail of UN1789 was punctured and released approximately 29-gallons of product to the trailer floor, adjacent cargo, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon OP. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site and containerized all impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. On June 18, 2024, FCE returned to continue remediation. Crews removed the impacted wooden pallets and packaging materials. All impacted debris was containerized as waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. On June 20, 2024, FCE returned to the site to further over pack the affected cargo of four (4) 55-gallon fiber drums. Crews collected and containerized the four (4) fiber drums into four (4) 95-gallon over pack poly drums and staged them onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060612
item.description:
Report E-2024060612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1814 was punctured while loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged tote was transferred into a new 330-gallon tote. The empty, damaged tote was removed for disposal. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal. On June 20, 2024, R+L requested crews return to the site to address lingering odors inside the trailer and excess dried product that remained on interior and exterior surfaces of the trailer. CES dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to assess and remediate. AOTC arrived and scraped excess material from the inside and outside trailer surfaces then wiped down surfaces with hot water and cleaning/neutralizing solution. All waste material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061473
item.description:
Report X-2024061473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=275942772492 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3480 CLASS=90 PSN TEXT=Lithium Ion Batteries PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=500 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=D - Fiberboard or cardboard NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=3 - Box TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=2 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram TECH NAME=Section IB )On 6/16/2024 at approximately 1950, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 906768 at the ramp facility in Denver, reporting and undeclared dangeorus goods spill. The shipment consisted of three glass bottles of hydrochloric acid and lithium battery powerbank. Two of the bottles spilled in transit, one of the bottles appeared to have shattered and the other leaked. The battery was illegally packaged with these commodities and the entire shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as the package was did not have the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. The spillage also affected an additional non-DG package. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024060630
item.description:
Report E-2024060630

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21 , 2024, at 0946 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Isopropyl Alcohol. It was reported terminal personnel discovered a release of approximately 1 cup of Isopropyl Alcohol (UN1219, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon DM due to being punctured. The release impacted the side of the drum only. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drum, then placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024060626
item.description:
Report E-2024060626

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to load drums into a trailer. During this process, the employee observed an odor. The employee stopped operating the forklift and went to investigate the source of the odor. Further investigation revealed that a drum in the trailer was leaking from a small pin sized puncture in the middle of its body. Approximately one pint of the liquid chemical had leaked from the drum and released onto the trailer floor. The duration of the spill was less than 5 minutes. The employee removed the leaking drum from the trailer and placed it into a salvage drum with absorbent. The spill was cleaned up by two other Veolia employees that were on the premises.
